==Events==
*[[1028]] &ndash; Future [[Byzantine emperor|Byzantine empress]] [[Zoe Porphyrogenita|Zoe]] takes the throne as empress consort to [[Romanus III|Romanus Argyrus]].
*[[1330]] &ndash; [[Battle of Posada]], Wallachian Voievode [[Basarab I]] defeats the Hungarian army in an ambush.
*[[1439]] &ndash; [[Plymouth]], England, becomes the first town incorporated by the [[Parliament of England|English Parliament]].
*[[1555]] &ndash; The English Parliament [[Established church|re-establishes]] [[Catholicism]].
*[[1602]] &ndash; [[Sebastian Viscaino]] lands at and names [[San Diego]], California.
*[[1793]] &ndash; [[Jean Sylvain Bailly]], the first [[Mayor of Paris]], is [[guillotine]]d.
*[[1892]] &ndash; [[William Heffelfinger|William "Pudge" Heffelfinger]] becomes the first professional [[American football]] player on record, participating in his first paid game for the [[Allegheny Athletic Association]].
*[[1893]] &ndash; The [[treaty]] of the [[Durand Line]] is signed between present day [[Pakistan]] and [[Afghanistan]]; the Durand Line has gained international recognition as an international border between the two nations.
*[[1905]] &ndash; [[Norway]] holds [[Norwegian monarchy plebiscite, 1905|a referendum]] in favor of monarchy over republic.
*[[1912]] &ndash; [[King George I of Greece]] makes a triumphal entry into [[Thessaloniki]] after it's liberation from 482 years of Ottoman rule.
*[[1912]] &ndash; The frozen bodies of [[Robert Falcon Scott|Robert Scott]] and his men are found on the [[Ross Ice Shelf]] in [[Antarctica]].
*[[1918]] &ndash; [[Austria]] becomes a [[First Austrian Republic|republic]].
*[[1920]] &ndash; Italy and the [[Kingdom of Yugoslavia|Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes]] sign the [[Treaty of Rapallo (1920)|Treaty of Rapallo]].
*[[1927]] &ndash; [[Leon Trotsky]] is expelled from the [[Soviet Communist Party]], leaving [[Joseph Stalin]] in undisputed control of the [[Soviet Union]].
*[[1928]] &ndash; {{SS|Vestris}} sinks approximately {{convert|200|mi|km}} off [[Hampton Roads, Virginia]], killing at least 110 passengers, mostly women and children who die after the vessel is abandoned.
*[[1933]] &ndash; Hugh Gray takes the first known photos alleged to be of the [[Loch Ness Monster]].
*[[1936]] &ndash; In California, the [[San Francisco – Oakland Bay Bridge]] opens to traffic.
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The [[Battle of Gabon]] ends as [[Free French Forces]] take [[Libreville]], [[Gabon]], and all of [[French Equatorial Africa]] from [[Vichy France|Vichy French]] forces.
*  1940   &ndash; World War II: Soviet Foreign Minister [[Vyacheslav Molotov]] arrives in Berlin to discuss [[German–Soviet Axis talks|the possibility of the Soviet Union joining the Axis Powers]].
*[[1941]] &ndash; World War II: Temperatures around Moscow drop to -12&nbsp;°C as the [[Soviet Union]] launches [[ski troops]] for the first time against the freezing German forces near the city.
*  1941   &ndash; World War II: The Soviet [[cruiser]] ''[[Chervona Ukraina]]'' is destroyed during the [[Battle of Sevastopol]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; World War II: [[Naval Battle of Guadalcanal]] between Japanese and American forces begins near [[Guadalcanal]]. The battle lasts for three days and ends with an American victory.
*[[1944]] &ndash; World War II: The [[Royal Air Force]] launches 29 [[Avro Lancaster]] bombers, which sink the German [[battleship]] ''[[German battleship Tirpitz|Tirpitz]]'', with 12,000&nbsp;lb [[Tallboy bomb]]s off [[Tromsø]], Norway.
*[[1945]] &ndash; [[Sudirman]] is elected the first commander-in-chief of the [[Indonesian Armed Forces]].
*[[1948]] &ndash; In Tokyo, an international [[war crime]]s tribunal sentences seven Japanese military and government officials, including General [[Hideki Tojo]], to death for their roles in [[World War II]].
*[[1956]] &ndash; [[Morocco]], [[Sudan]] and [[Tunisia]] join the United Nations.
*  1956   &ndash; In the midst of the [[Suez Crisis]], Palestinian refugees are [[Rafah massacre|shot dead]] in the village of [[Rafah]] by Israeli soldiers following the invasion of the [[Gaza Strip]].
*[[1958]] &ndash; A team of rock climbers led by [[Warren Harding (climber)|Warren Harding]] completes the first ascent of [[The Nose (El Capitan)|The Nose]] on [[El Capitan]] in [[Yosemite Valley]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[Equatorial Guinea]] joins the United Nations.
*[[1969]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: [[My Lai Massacre]] &ndash; Independent investigative journalist [[Seymour Hersh]] breaks the [[My Lai]] story.
*[[1970]] &ndash; The [[Oregon Highway Division]] attempts to destroy a rotting beached [[Sperm whale]] with explosives, leading to the now infamous [[Exploding whale#Oregon|"exploding whale"]] incident.
*  1970   &ndash; The [[1970 Bhola cyclone]] makes landfall on the coast of [[East Pakistan]] becoming the deadliest tropical cyclone in history.
*[[1971]] &ndash; Vietnam War: As part of [[Vietnamization]], US President [[Richard M. Nixon]] sets February 1, 1972 as the deadline for the removal of another 45,000 American troops from [[Vietnam]].
*[[1975]] &ndash; The [[Comoros]] joins the United Nations.
*[[1978]] &ndash; [[Pope John Paul II]] takes possession of his Cathedral Church, the [[Basilica of St. John Lateran]], as the [[Bishop (Catholicism)|Bishop]] of Rome.
*[[1979]] &ndash; [[Iran hostage crisis]]: In response to the hostage situation in [[Tehran]], US President [[Jimmy Carter]] orders a halt to all petroleum imports into the United States from [[Iran]].
*[[1980]] &ndash; The [[NASA]] space probe ''[[Voyager I]]'' makes its closest approach to [[Saturn]] and takes the first images of its [[Rings of Saturn|rings]].
*[[1981]] &ndash; [[Space Shuttle program]]: Mission [[STS-2]], utilizing the [[Space Shuttle]] ''[[Space Shuttle Columbia|Columbia]]'', marks the first time a manned [[spacecraft]] is launched into space twice.
*[[1982]] &ndash; In the [[Soviet Union]], [[Yuri Andropov]] becomes the [[General Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union|General Secretary]] of the [[Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union|Communist Party's Central Committee]], succeeding [[Leonid I. Brezhnev]].
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[Crown Prince]] [[Akihito]] is formally installed as Emperor Akihito of Japan, becoming the 125th Japanese monarch.
*  1990   &ndash; [[Tim Berners-Lee]] publishes a formal proposal for the [[World Wide Web]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Dili Massacre]]: Indonesian forces open fire on a crowd of student protesters in [[Dili]], East Timor.
*[[1993]] &ndash; The first [[Ultimate Fighting Championship]] event, [[UFC 1]], is held in Denver, Colorado.
*[[1996]] &ndash; A [[Saudi Arabian Airlines]] [[Boeing 747]] and a Kazakh [[Ilyushin Il-76]] cargo plane [[Charkhi Dadri mid-air collision|collide in mid-air]] near New Delhi, killing 349. The deadliest mid-air collision to date.
*[[1997]] &ndash; [[Ramzi Yousef]] is found guilty of masterminding the 1993 [[World Trade Center bombing]].
*[[1999]] &ndash; The [[Düzce earthquake]] strikes [[Turkey]] with a magnitude of 7.2 on the [[Richter magnitude scale|Richter scale]].
*[[2001]] &ndash; In New York City, [[American Airlines Flight 587]], an [[Airbus A300]] ''en route'' to the [[Dominican Republic]], crashes minutes after takeoff from [[John F. Kennedy International Airport]], killing all 260 on board and five on the ground.
*  2001   &ndash; [[War in Afghanistan (2001–present)#Fall of Kabul|Attack on Afghanistan]]: [[Taliban]] forces abandon [[Kabul, Afghanistan]], ahead of advancing [[Afghan Northern Alliance]] troops.
*[[2003]] &ndash; [[Iraq war]]: In [[Nasiriya, Iraq]], at least 23 people, among them the first Italian casualties of the [[2003 invasion of Iraq]], are killed in a suicide bomb attack on an Italian police base.
*  2003   &ndash; [[Shanghai Transrapid]] sets a new [[Land speed record for rail vehicles|world speed record]] ({{convert|501|km/h|mph}}) for commercial railway systems, which remains the fastest for unmodified commercial rail vehicles.
*[[2011]] &ndash; [[Silvio Berlusconi]] tenders his resignation as Prime Minister of Italy, effective November 16, due in large part to the [[European sovereign debt crisis]].
